topic.title: RedIceRadio - The Cosmic Serpent - Jeremy Narby
topic.body:
Incredible podcast (now censored and deleted) by RedIceRadio interviewing Jeremy Narby about anthropology and mythology and a counter theory about the antediluvian origins of our world. 

From WIkipedia:
Jeremy Narby is a Canadian anthropologist and author. He studied history at the University of Kent at Canterbury, and received a doctorate in anthropology from Stanford University.

Narby spent several years living with the Ashaninca in the Peruvian Amazon cataloging indigenous uses of rainforest resources to help combat ecological destruction.

Narby has written three books, as well as sponsored an expedition to the rainforest for biologists and other scientists to examine indigenous knowledge systems and the utility of Ayahuasca in gaining knowledge. Investigating the connections between shamanism and molecular biology, Narby hypothesizes that shamans may be able to access information at the molecular level through the ingestion of entheogens, specifically ayahuasca. The resulting documentary film was Night of the Liana.

Since 1989, Narby has been working as the Amazonian projects director for the Swiss NGO, Nouvelle PlanÃ¨te.

The Cosmic Serpent: DNA and the Origins of Knowledge (1995) ISBN 0-87477-911-1

Shamans Through Time: 500 Years on the Path to Knowledge (2001) edited by Jeremy Narby and Francis Huxley ISBN 1-58542-091-3

Intelligence in Nature (2005) ISBN 1-58542-399-8

Psychotropic Mind: The World According to Ayahuasca, Iboga, and Shamanism (2010) ISBN 978-1-59477-312-9

Podcast:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/1G6SeTLb1v6LQfgg7ee4VuGQ61wkNVqdzz/RedIceRadio%20-%20The%20Cosmic%20Serpent%20-%20Jeremy%20Narby.mp4

topic.title: ThuleanPerspective - The Grey Wolf has become the White

1577913264_1GGwcwi7tW4RZaAfG3xPR4JpoNE4A.body:
> [aspidochelone](#comment_297_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): I couldn't access your video link either.  The twitter link leads to ... a bunch of Twitter crap.  How the fuck does anybody ever figure out what they're supposed to look at based on a link to some account name? [...]

Video works fine for me.

> [reichardnixon](#comment_90_16NfWw2hgzGaVcQs35UJySKMf4YP9kZFbr): Your link does not work for me.

Video works fine for me.

> [aspidochelone](#comment_297_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): Nobody has ever stopped a Nazi by making his speech illegal, because Nazis are weakest when they talk - their strength is in murder and corruption.

"Nobody has ever stopped a Nazi by making his speech illegal, because Nazis are weakest when they talk - their strength is in murder and corruption."

[citation needed]

1578262489_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: Just get a Mikrotik Hex lite and put it between the proxy box and your home router. Then force it to dial a permanent VPN session with a kill switch. Block all IPv6. It will make it just irritating enough for them to skip and find easier targets. Also make sure the firewall is properly setup and block everything that isn't necessary.
